item.title: The Very Soul Of the Silicon
item.description: Coming Soon!! And now I see with eye serene The very pulse, of the machine

item.title: Flutter Apps :2
item.description: Disclaimer This is Part 2 of a series of articles that explore and seek to provide newcomers with a high-level overview of what all the parts of an app consist of and do, so that they can hit the ground running.

item.title: The Heralds Of A New Web
item.description: The Internet The web has always been a place for great minds to push the limits of what’s possible; what can be created; experienced.

item.title: Being Valedictorian - My Thoughts
item.description: On the 15th of June, this year, as Valedictorian, I gave a speech on the graduation ceremony of my batch, addressing my friends, my teachers, our supervisors, and everyone else present.

item.title: Exploring Flutter
item.description: Flutter is an open source cross-platform app building framework created by Google, that uses the Dart programming language.

item.title: Architecting a Flutter app…and it’s importance
item.description: Disclaimer This article is written to discuss and provide a beginner friendly perspective on architecture, why it’s important, and how to implement it.

item.title: Flutter Apps :3
item.description: Disclaimer This is Part 3 and the final part of a series of articles that explore and seek to provide newcomers with a high-level overview of what all the parts of a Flutter app consist of and do, so that they can hit the ground running.

item.title: This Website, but even better (The Third)
item.description: Under The Hood Where to even start. This update, apart from being massive in both development time and lines of code edited (or even added) was also quite underwhelming in that a significant portion of the improvements have no visual footprint.

item.title: A Ghost In The Shell
item.description: Humans are….. impressionable beings by nature, a trait caused by the immense adaptability we are gifted with, the very thing that took us from hunter gatherers to the dominant lifeforms on this planet, from rubbing rocks together to make fire to terraforming the planet to our needs.

item.title: This Website, but better
item.description: The Sparkly One Update 2.0 of my site brings about a huge number of visual upgrades to the site, overhauls the site traversal menu (turning it into menus) and sets the groundwork for both Update 3.

item.title: Flutter Apps :1
item.description: Disclaimer This article is meant to be a starting point for people new to coding and trying their hand at Dart and Flutter, much as I was and did.

item.title: How do I make X?
item.description: Preambles Ideas are a fickle, elusive thing. They come to us in droves, or sometimes not at all.
